lines.gurmukhi: pMc prpMc kY Bey hY mhwNBwrQ sy pMc mwir kwhUAY n duibDw invwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Panch Parapanch Kai Bhaay Hai Mahaanbhaarad Say , Panch Maari Kaahooai N Doubidhaa Nivaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: During the times of Mahabharat, there had many warriors like the five Pandavas in the past but none ever endeavoured to end his duality by destroying the five vices residing within.

lines.gurmukhi: giH qij nv nwQ isiD jogIsur huie n qiRgun AqIq inj Awsn mY qwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Grih Taji Nav Naad Sidhi Jogeesur Hui Na , Trigoun Ateet Nij Aasan Mai Taaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Renouncing home and family, many became the Masters, Sidhs and sages, but none had engrossed his mind in the higher spiritual state by keeping oneself free of the effect of the three traits of maya.

lines.gurmukhi: byd pwT piV piV pMfq prboDY jgu sky n smoD mn qiRsnw n hwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bayd Paatth Parhi Parhi Pandat Parabodhai Jagu , Sakay N Samodh Man Trisanaa N Haaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A learned person imparts knowledge to the world by studying the Vedas and other scriptures, but he could not bring around his own mind nor end his worldly desires.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gurdyv syv swDsMg sbd suriq ilv bHm bIcwrI hY ]457]
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gurdayv Sayv Saadhasanga , Sabad Surati Liv Braham Beechaaree Hai ?457?

Shabad OS B.translation: A devoted Sikh of the Guru who in the company of saintly persons, and serving the Lord-like True Guru has engrossed his mind in the divine word, is in reality the real scholar of the Lord.  (457)
